document_title: Alcoholic cirrhosis: Symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: xo-gan-do-ruou.json_6_How to treat cirrhosis caused by alcohol
subsection_content:
The two main goals in treating alcoholic cirrhosis are: helping patients quit drinking and improving liver health.
1. Limit alcohol intake
Limiting alcohol is an important factor in treating alcoholic cirrhosis.
Limiting alcohol is a prerequisite in the treatment of alcoholic cirrhosis. This helps support treatment and prevent severe disease progression. For heavy drinkers, stopping drinking suddenly will lead to problems such as anxiety, fatigue, headaches, nausea, agitation... At this time, the patient will be prescribed medication and intravenous fluids. pulse or sedatives until alcohol detox is complete. Normally, patients will feel positive improvements after about 3 months of reducing alcohol.
2. Supportive care (eating and living habits)
Long-term alcoholics often have malnutrition due to lack of calories, protein, vitamins and minerals, so these nutrients need to be supplemented through diet. Milk is a good product full of nutrients, suitable for people with cirrhosis.
